song_name: One Less Bell To Answer / A House Is Not A Home
lyrics:
April (Will):
One less bell to answer
One less egg to fry
One less man to pick up after
I should be happy, but all I do is cry (Will: Cry, cry no more laughter)

Oh, I should be happy  (Will: Oh why did she go?)
I only know that since he left, my life's so empty
Though I try to forget, it just can't be done
Each time the doorbell rings, I still run

I don't know how in the world to stop thinking of him
(Will: I should be happy) 'Cause I still love him so
I end each day the way I start out, crying my heart out
(Will: I start and end each day crying)

One less bell to answer
One less egg to fry
One less man (Will: One less man) to pick up after
No more laughter, no more love
Since he went away (Will: Since she went away)
Since he went away

Oooh, a chair is still a chair
Even when there's no one sitting there
Well, I'm not meant to live alone
Turn this house into a home
When I climb the stair and turn the key
Oh please, be there, still in love with me

(Will: One less bell to answer) Each time the doorbell rings I still run
(Will: One less egg to fry) I got one less man (Will: One less man) to pick up after
(Will: No more) No more laughter, no more love
Since he went away (Will: Since she went away)
Since he went away
All I do is cry
